repnme.cdata!:
Central African Republic - Education
            Rehabilitation and Development, Third Education Project

abstracts.cdata!:
This is the Implementation Completion
            Report (ICR) for the Education Rehabilitation and
            Development Project in the Central African Republic. The
            project had two specific objectives: (a) to improve the
            quality of primary and higher education; (b) to strengthen
            the capacity for managing the education system at the level
            of the Ministry of National Education, Scientific Research
            and Technology (MENRST) and the University of Bangui.
            Project implementation was satisfactory overall, and was
            virtually finished by the closing date of the credit. Bank
            supervision of implementation was regular and effective. The
            Borrower's participation was effective during project
            preparation, and particularly satisfactory during
            implementation, given the lack of changes in the Project
            Coordination Unit (PCU) team, which was well trained and had
            access to good technical assistance. Some of the lessons
            learned included: 1) Implementation of a complex project
            over a long period in a context of social instability can be
            satisfactory, particularly as regards the physical
            components, if there is a stable local team well-versed in
            procurement procedures and regularly supervised by the Bank;
            2) Achieving objectives that depend on structural reform and
            the upgrading of professional skills may be more difficult,
            but the progress made -- even if only partial -- can serve
            as a foundation for future sector work; and 3) The entire
            institutional strengthening aspect should be rethought,
            since the approach selected has not produced the intended results.

repnme.cdata!:
Central African Republic - Education
            Rehabilitation and Development Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The Education Rehabilitation and
            Development Project, Third Education Project supports the
            Government's education strategy within its structural
            adjustment framework, by reviewing annually an action plan
            containing sector budgetary targets, the scholarship program
            and budget, and staffing and pedagogical targets.
            Specifically, the project aims to rehabilitate the education
            system for improved quality and efficiency in primary
            schooling and higher education.  It also hopes to improve
            sector management for a more effective use of resources in
            the Ministry of National Education and higher education.
